Name: CIS Alibaba Cloud Foundations Benchmark v2.0.0
Description: The CIS Alibaba Cloud Foundations Benchmark provides prescriptive guidance for configuring security options for a subset of Alibaba Cloud services with an emphasis on foundational, testable, and architecture agnostic settings.

Requirements.Name: Identity and Access Management
Requirements.Description: This section contains recommendations for configuring identity and access management related options.

Attributes.Description: This section contains recommendations for configuring identity and access management related options.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: The principle of least privilege should be used for access control to resources.
Attributes.ImpactStatement: Implementing least privilege requires proper planning and ongoing maintenance.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Follow the remediation instructions for each specific control.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Review RAM users, policies, and access controls.
Attributes.AdditionalInformation: Identity and Access Management is critical for security.

Requirements.Description: Ensure no root account access key exists

Attributes.Description: Access keys provide programmatic access to a given Alibaba Cloud account. It is recommended that all access keys associated with the root account be removed.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: The root account is the most privileged user in an Alibaba Cloud account. Removing access keys associated with the root account limits vectors by which the account can be compromised.
Attributes.ImpactStatement: Programs that already use root account access keys may stop working if you disable or delete the access keys.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Delete or disable all access keys for the root account.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Using the management console, verify that no access key exists for the root account.

Requirements.Description: Ensure that multi-factor authentication is enabled for all RAM users that have a console password

Attributes.Description: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) adds an extra layer of protection on top of a username and password.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: MFA requires users to verify their identities by entering two authentication factors. The additional security makes it harder for an attacker to gain access to protected resources or data.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable MFA for all RAM users with console access.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that all RAM users with console access have MFA enabled.

Requirements.Description: Ensure access keys are rotated every 90 days or less

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that all access keys be regularly rotated.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Access keys might be compromised. Rotating access keys will reduce the window of opportunity that a compromised access key can be used.
Attributes.ImpactStatement: Programs that use access keys may stop working if you rotate the access keys without replacing them in your program prior to the rotation.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Create new access keys and update applications, then delete old keys.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that all access keys are rotated within 90 days.

Requirements.Description: Ensure RAM password policy requires at least one uppercase letter

Attributes.Description: RAM password policies can be used to ensure password complexity.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Enhancing complexity of a password policy increases account resiliency against brute force logon attempts.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Set the password policy to require at least one uppercase letter.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that the password policy requires at least one uppercase letter.

Requirements.Description: Ensure RAM policies are attached only to groups or roles

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that RAM policies be applied directly to groups and roles but not users.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Assigning privileges at the group or role level reduces the complexity of access management.
Attributes.ImpactStatement: Users may need to be added to appropriate groups to retain their current permissions.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Create user groups and assign policies to those groups instead of individual users.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that no policies are directly attached to RAM users.

Requirements.Description: Ensure log monitoring and alerts are set up for RAM Role changes

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that a query and alarm should be established for RAM Role creation, deletion and updating activities.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Monitoring role creation, deletion and updating activities will help in identifying any potential malicious actions at early stage.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable Action Trail and configure alerts for RAM Role changes.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that alerts are configured for RAM Role changes.

Requirements.Description: Ensure log monitoring and alerts are set up for Cloud Firewall changes

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for Cloud Firewall rule changes.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Monitoring for Create or Update firewall rule events gives insight network access changes and may reduce the time it takes to detect suspicious activity.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable Action Trail and configure alerts for Cloud Firewall changes.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that alerts are configured for Cloud Firewall changes.

Requirements.Description: Ensure log monitoring and alerts are set up for VPC network route changes

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for VPC network route changes.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Monitoring changes to route tables will help ensure that all VPC traffic flows through an expected path.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable Action Trail and configure alerts for VPC network route changes.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that alerts are configured for VPC network route changes.

Requirements.Description: Ensure log monitoring and alerts are set up for VPC changes

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that a log search/analysis query and alarm be established for VPC changes.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Monitoring changes to VPC will help ensure VPC traffic flow is not getting impacted.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable Action Trail and configure alerts for VPC changes.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that alerts are configured for VPC changes.

Requirements.Description: Ensure log monitoring and alerts are set up for OSS permission changes

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for OSS Bucket RAM changes.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Monitoring changes to OSS permissions may reduce time to detect and correct permissions on sensitive OSS bucket and objects inside the bucket.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable OSS logging and configure alerts for OSS permission changes.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that alerts are configured for OSS permission changes.

Requirements.Description: Ensure log monitoring and alerts are set up for RDS instance configuration changes

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that a metric filter and alarm be established for RDS Instance configuration changes.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Monitoring changes to RDS Instance configuration changes may reduce time to detect and correct misconfigurations done on database server.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable Action Trail and configure alerts for RDS instance configuration changes.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that alerts are configured for RDS instance configuration changes.

Requirements.Description: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for unauthorized API calls

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that a query and alarm be established for unauthorized API calls.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Monitoring unauthorized API calls will help reveal application errors and may reduce time to detect malicious activity.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable Action Trail and configure alerts for unauthorized API calls.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that alerts are configured for unauthorized API calls.

Requirements.Description: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for Management Console sign-in without MFA

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that a query and alarm be established for console logins that are not protected by multi-factor authentication (MFA).
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Monitoring for single-factor console logins will increase visibility into accounts that are not protected by MFA.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable Action Trail and configure alerts for Management Console sign-in without MFA.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that alerts are configured for Management Console sign-in without MFA.

Requirements.Description: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for usage of "root" account

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that a query and alarm be established for console logins that are not protected by root login attempts.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Monitoring for root account logins will provide visibility into the use of a fully privileged account and an opportunity to reduce the use of it.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable Action Trail and configure alerts for root account usage.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that alerts are configured for root account usage.

Requirements.Description: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for Management Console authentication failures

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that a query and alarm be established for failed console authentication attempts.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Monitoring failed console logins may decrease lead time to detect an attempt to brute force a credential, which may provide an indicator, such as source IP, that can be used in other event correlation.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable Action Trail and configure alerts for Management Console authentication failures.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that alerts are configured for Management Console authentication failures.

Requirements.Description: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for disabling or deletion of customer created CMKs

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that a query and alarm be established for customer created KMSs which have changed state to disabled or deletion.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Data encrypted with disabled or deleted keys will no longer be accessible.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable Action Trail and configure alerts for disabling or deletion of customer created CMKs.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that alerts are configured for disabling or deletion of customer created CMKs.

Requirements.Description: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for OSS bucket policy changes

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that a query and alarm be established for changes to OSS bucket policies.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Monitoring changes to OSS bucket policies may reduce time to detect and correct permissive policies on sensitive OSS buckets.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable Action Trail and configure alerts for OSS bucket policy changes.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that alerts are configured for OSS bucket policy changes.

Requirements.Description: Ensure a log monitoring and alerts are set up for security group changes

Attributes.Description: It is recommended that a query and alarm be established changes to Security Groups.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: Monitoring changes to security group will help ensure that resources and services are not unintentionally exposed.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Enable Action Trail and configure alerts for security group changes.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that alerts are configured for security group changes.

Requirements.Description: Ensure that Logstore data retention period is set 365 days or greater

Attributes.Description: Ensure Activity Log Retention is set for 365 days or greater.
Attributes.RationaleStatement: It is recommended to retain your activity log for 365 days or more in order to have time to respond to any incidents.
Attributes.RemediationProcedure: Modify the Data Retention Period to 365 or greater.
Attributes.AuditProcedure: Verify that the Data Retention Period is set to 365 or greater.
